instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> all power rails present but cpu not turning on
threads.message:
I got this board today that was liquid damaged. The user told me they took it to 'ubreakifix' and they replaced the keyboard and cleaned the board. It looked like they didn't clean it well because I saw corrosion and red probe points around the <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> / <CHIP>U7870</CHIP> area.
There was a light on the charger but no fan spin. The only power rails that were missing were <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>.
I added flux to the corroded areas and heated it up before throwing it in the crest ultrasonic.
After the ultrasonic the fan spins and now <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> are present but I get nothing on the screen.
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is showing 1.8v but yet when the machine isn't chiming nor is the cpu getting hot.

I'm not sure why the cpu is not turning on if the voltage is present.
Also, the fan doesn't turn on and off 3 times like the '13 and 14' airs. Does that not happen with these 2015 Airs?

Update: <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and both sides of <RESISTOR>R1950</RESISTOR> are 3.32v and the resistors around <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> measured proper resistance. When I measure pin 7 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> I get around .25v and it goes down.
Also, on <RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR> when I plug the charger in the highest voltage I got was 0.7v and it goes down quickly from there. For some reason the fan will spin on high and I'm not sure if it is has anything to do with me probing on <RESISTOR>R1962</RESISTOR> but the fan will just stop spinning and not come back on.

Note: These measurements were done with the board separated from the Macbook.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> all power rails present but cpu not turning on
threads.message: <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> will have a corroded pin. Pull it and inspect/replace.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> all power rails present but cpu not turning on
threads.message: I removed <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, gently scraped one of the pins and replaced it and now it works. Thanks problem solved.
